headline: Robinhood Weighs Trump Accounts Role While Chasing SpaceX And Tokenization
summary: U.S. regulators are weighing Robinhood Markets (NasdaqGS:HOOD) as a potential trustee for new federal "Trump Accounts" for children, which would tie the app directly to a nationwide savings program. At the same time, Robinhood is pushing for a large retail share in SpaceX's planned mega IPO, aiming to route significant individual investor demand into the offering. The company is also expanding into tokenized stocks and regulated prediction markets, targeting new ways for retail users to...

headline: Oracle to raise $50B for AI, Devon‚ÄìCoterra deal, crypto stocks fall
summary: Yahoo Finance Markets and Data Editor Jared Blikre joins Morning Brief host Julie Hyman to take a look at some of Monday morning's trending tickers and stories. Devon Energy Corporation (DVN) will acquire Coterra (CTRA) in an all-stock deal. Oracle (ORCL) said it would raise $50 billion for its artificial intelligence (AI) build-out.   Crypto stocks, including Strategy (MSTR), Coinbase (COIN), and Robinhood (HOOD), are all trading lower. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Strategy Stock Drops as Bitcoin Price Sinks. MSTR Is Doubling Down on Its Bet.
summary: Strategy  stock declined after the price of  Bitcoin  tanked over the weekend, souring its cryptocurrency bet.  Strategy revealed in a securities filing Monday that it had snapped up 855 tokens for roughly $87,974 each, or $75.3 million in total, in the preceding seven-day period.  Strategy is no stranger to criticism.

headline: Bitcoin Rises After Hitting 10-Month Low. Why Trump‚Äôs Fed Pick Hurt Cryptos.
summary: Bitcoin tumbled to a 10-month low early Monday amid a broad digital currency selloff, before mounting a tentative recovery.  The move follows Kevin Warsh‚Äôs recent nomination as the next head of the Federal Reserve.  Bitcoin  was trading at $78,702 early in the day, up around 1.4% over the past 24 hours, according to CoinDesk data.

headline: Why Robinhood (HOOD) Shares Are Getting Obliterated Today
summary: Shares of financial services company Robinhood (NASDAQ:HOOD) fell 8.2% in the afternoon session along with other crypto-linked companies as a drop in bitcoin prices sparked concerns about slowing trading volumes. As a company with significant exposure to cryptocurrency trading, Robinhood's performance is often tied to the movements of major digital assets like bitcoin. The decline in token prices was seen as a key factor impacting the stock. Adding to the negative sentiment were broader concerns
